data.title: A Cautionary Advice To A Young Friend
data.text:
A Cautionary Advice To A Young Friend

Proverbs 30

KJV

17+ The eye that mocketh at his father, and despiseth to obey his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.

 

Many of us the aged have for friends some young men and women. Occasionally we meet and interact, and we tell one another “What was and  what is!”

 

Generations differ no one doubts this, however, some principles don’t change with generational change. 

 

The rate at which societal values are changing has been a source of worry and concern to the older generation! In a conversation with a young friend, this issue came up. 

 

The conclusion we both came up with was “ somebody ( a generation) went to sleep” A generation failed to uphold and pass on to the other what it received. It is this failure that has brought us to where we are today! The question was How do we then reset the clock? 

 

We see and experience these in every sphere of life be it social, church, family or national. Had the failed generation followed the principle of transferring to others what it received we would have maintain high moral and ethical standards and sanity. 

 

Just like the Church we have kept and observe the Lord’s Supper because, as Paul said ; 

Corinthians 11

KJV

23+ For I have received of the Lord that which also I delivered unto you, That the Lord Jesus the same night in which he was betrayed took bread:

 

We have passed on to us values that have kept past generations sound, united, responsive and respectful. Today all these have crumbled before our very eyes. This is a laissez-faire generation! 

 

The sages of old have always held as sacrosanct this commandment;

Proverbs 23

KJV

22+ Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.

 

Proverbs 1

KJV

8+ My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

 

Ephesians 6

KJV

1+ Children, obey your parents in the Lord: for this is right.

2+ Honour thy father and mother; (which is the first commandment with promise;)

 

What do we see today? 

 

Proverbs 30

KJV

11+ There is a generation that curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother.

 

Proverbs 30

KJV

12+ There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, and yet is not washed from their filthiness.

 

Yes, the “old order changeth”, but eternal laws/principles, truths etc remain the same. These are what is called the “ eternal non-negotiable principles and laws”

 

One of which is respect for the elderly, in whom reside refined quality thought, wisdom and common sense as a result of experience gathered through life!

 

If only we could all pay attention to this warning, our journey would be smooth and end well!  

Proverbs 20

KJV

20+ Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.

 

Every generation was once a youthful generation, blessed are those who recognize that progress and success lie in the degree and extent to which they treat those who were before them.

 

Everything is an inheritance, a transference from one generation to the other. What have you inherited? And from whom? Your deeds etc will reveal what you inherited and from whom! 

 

Eyes are watching l! 

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: A Wicked Heart
data.text:
A Wicked Heart

Proverbs 24

KJV

29+ Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me: I will render to the man according to his work.

 

Proverbs 3

KJV

28+ Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.

 

A wicked heart is difficult to define but is noted ( identified ) by some of the characteristics indicated in the above scripture passages. The contents of a wicked heart are seen through deeds. 

 

It is a heart that conceives, plans and executes evil as if it were for fun! A wicked heart is a heart that rejoices and stands aloof when others suffer. It is self-centred. 

 

It is also a heart full of vengeance, that knows no forgiveness unless he has paid back evil with evil. It is a vindictive heart! It is a hypocritical, pretentious heart that laughs /smiles but will stab at the first opportunity it gets  

 

Read the psalmist’s experience which he captured in these vivid words; 

 

Psalm 41:6,9

NIV

[6] When one of them comes to see me, he speaks falsely, while his heart gathers slander; then he goes out and spreads it around. [9] Even my close friend, someone I trusted, one who shared my bread, has turned against me.

 

A wicked heart is that heart that shops and bargains ready to sell when the price offered is right. 

 

Though we live, work and walk with people with wicked hearts, there is not much that we can do except to watch, pray and hide under the protective canopy of God.

 

May we continuously search and know the type of heart we have as we are told the heart can be deceptive. 

 

Jeremiah 17

KJV

9 The heart is deceitful above all things, and desperately wicked: who can know it?

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: When The Tongue Is A Pen
data.text:
Psalms 45
KJV
1+ My heart is inditing a good matter: I speak of the things which I have made touching the king: my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.

 

Psalm 45:1 
NIV
[1] My heart is stirred by a noble theme as I recite my verses for the king; my tongue is the pen of a skillful writer.

 

Like me, I am sure  you don’t know, nor has it ever occurred to you that the “  tongue is a pen!”

 

I found this verse very interesting especially as it described the “tongue” as a pen!  “My tongue is the pen of a skillful writer”!

 

Indeed some speak just as they write; this is a gift. Very skillful in their choices of words either spoken or written. It is always a delight to hear them speak or read what they write

 

To speak therefore is the same as to write with a pen,  one is audible the other silent, they all have the same audience!

 

Words spoken or written can be classified into two categories: wise and unwise. They can make or break the spirit of their hearers or readers.

 

Therefore heed this admonition; 
Proverbs 25
KJV
11+ A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.

Proverbs 15:23 
NIV
[23] A person finds joy in giving an apt reply---and how good is a timely word!

 

Timely words are very important, read how Isaiah puts it ;  

Isaiah 50
KJV
4+ The Lord God hath given me the tongue of the learned, that I should know how to speak a word in season to him that is weary: he wakeneth morning by morning, he wakeneth mine ear to hear as the learned.

Words whether spoken or written live forever in the minds of both hearers and readers. Their effects may be forgiven or forgotten but not the words.

 

On a practical note, I’ve had many referring me to things I’ve said or written before. Some in context others taken out of context!

 

It is also important to note that the words we speak or write will be recalled on the Day of Judgment as testimonies for or against us.

 

Matthew 12
KJV
36 But I say unto you, That every idle word that men shall speak, they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment.

37+ For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.

James also warned ; 


James 3:1-2 
NIV
[1] Not many of you should become teachers, my fellow believers, because you know that we who teach will be judged more strictly.

[2] We all stumble in many ways. Anyone who is never at fault in what they say is perfect, able to keep their whole body in check.

 

So, beloved choose your words, do your best to let them be appropriate and relevant to the occasion. Be measured and economical in the use of words; either spoken or written.

 

The tongue is a pen, use it wisely! In writing we think through before we put any word on paper, in like manner train your tongue to weigh words before they are uttered.

 

The careless use of words has caused many a relationship, either friendship or marriage.

 

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: The World Shall Hear Of Me Again
data.text:
Acts 1
KJV
11+ Which also said, Ye men of Galilee, why stand ye gazing up into heaven? this same Jesus, which is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come in like manner as ye have seen him go into heaven.

 

This was said many centuries ago and has remained the main hope and expectation of all believers! 
Can it truly be said that we await with preparation and expectation,  His second coming?  

 

When was the last time you heard a sermon on The Second Coming? It has been assumed and therefore pushed to the back burner. This explains why the faith of many has grown cold because they’ve lost appetite for heaven. Hmmm

 

Rereading these scriptures brought to mind the famous statement often heard at the end of every Fu Manchu film series from the lips of popular actor Christopher Lee, aka Fu Manchu!

 

In our youth (1960/70) we watched a series of films depicting a notorious underworld figure called Fu Manchu. Though at the end of every series he would be caught, yet before the film is brought to a close he would appear and utter the words “ the world shall hear of me again”

 

As naive as we then were, this statement from Fu Manchu frightens us because we see him appear in another episode; we often wonder how he could reappear after his death! Truly, It is great to be young!

 

Reading what the angel told the disciples should remind us that  “ 
this same Jesus, which is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come in like manner as ye have seen him go into heaven.”

 

This means Jesus will return in a physical form and not as a spirit as some claim and will be seen by all! What is unknown is the when! The ‘how’ we know, the ‘where He will come from’  we know.

 

Have you thought about this? On that day a great mystery shall be solved as we shall see Him as He is! Whether white, black, yellow-skinned etc we don’t know. That day and hour shall declare! Truly we look forward to that day and His appearance.

 

Beloved, since we don’t know the “when” let each be always ready so His return does not take him/her unaware. The question that should be of great concern  is where will He find us? In what state or condition? Peaceful or angry, loving or hating? Etc. Think about this.

 

This question worried Fanny J Crosby (1820-1915)  a blind songwriter which led her to write this hymn ;

 

1.    When Jesus comes to reward His servants,
Whether it be noon or night,
Faithful to Him will He find us watching,
With our lamps all trimmed and bright?

 

(Oh, can we say we are ready, brother?
Ready for the soul’s bright home?
Say, will He find you and me still watching,
Waiting, waiting when the Lord shall come?)

 

2
If at the dawn of the early morning,
He shall call us one by one,
When to the Lord we restore our talents,
Will He answer thee—Well done?

 

3
Have we been true to the trust He left us?
Do we seek to do our best?
If in our hearts there is naught condemns us,
We shall have a glorious rest.

 

4
Blessed are those whom the Lord finds watching,
In His glory they shall share;
If He shall come at the dawn or midnight,
Will He find us watching there?

 

How do we answer these questions? Yes, the world shall hear of Him again?

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: Teach Yourself How To Walk In The Truth
data.text:
(series 5)
3 John 1
KJV
3 For I rejoiced greatly, when the brethren came and testified of the truth that is in thee, even as thou walkest in the truth.
4+ I have no greater joy than to hear that my children walk in truth.

Life’s lessons are taught by following a systematically arranged curriculum or through experience. There is “ systematic truth “ and “ experiential Truth”.

The pursuit of both is recommended and desirable, but the experiential is the most preferred. An effective, useful, and successful person possesses the combination of both classroom and street ( experiential) sense!

As the psalmist requested, truth must be taught ;
Psalms 86
KJV
11+ Teach me thy way, O Lord; I will walk in thy truth: unite my heart to fear thy name.

In the case of Christianity, an effective useful child of God is the one who not only knows the scriptures ( theoretical) but can apply them in the real world It is not about “ quotation “ it is about “ application”.

Two things are highlighted in the above scripture passages, “to walk in the truth” and “to walk in truth”. The two statements are not the same.

The first presupposes that there is a body of knowledge called “ the truth “ which one must uphold and apply to be described as “ walking in the truth”

To live and do things as stated in the scriptures is to “ walk in the truth as scripture is the Truth
John 17
KJV
17+ Sanctify them through thy truth: thy word is truth.

The question we must ask ourselves daily is “Are we walking in the truth?” Are we living lives that are consistent and in conformity with the Truth?” The Word.

The second thought conveyed in the verses above is “ walking in truth” To walk In Truth is simply to be sincere, honest, to be a promise keeper, reliable, trustworthy, your word is your bond. One word sums it up “ principled”.

To walk in the teeth gladdens the heart of God and fellow man. The Apostle John could not hide his joy when he saw and experienced the life of the children of a Christian sister.

2 John 1
KJV
4+ I rejoiced greatly that I found of thy children walking in truth, as we have received a commandment from the Father.

When the knowledge of the Word of God influences us it makes us walk in truth. We deal sincerely and honestly with people as we live principled lives.

Interestingly, it is only fellow principled people who see this and admire the principled. The unprincipled finds it difficult to understand let alone accept them!

Yes, darkness and light can not coexist. The vulgar, rude, uncouth etc can not coexist with the disciplined, decent-minded, orderly etc. We see these every day as we relate to people.

Ever wondered why some disliked, speak evil of you, why your presence in their midst disturbs them etc? It is because you Walk In Truth. You call a spade a spade and not a shovel You are principled!

Read God’s promise to the principled, those who walk in truth ;
1 Kings 2
KJV
4+ That the Lord may continue his word which he spake concerning me, saying, If thy children take heed to their way, to walk before me in truth with all their heart and with all their soul, there shall not fail thee (said he) a man on the throne of Israel.

Beloved, teach yourself how to walk not only in the truth but also in truth!

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: Don’t Let The Green Grass Fool You!
data.text:
Genesis 13
KJV
10+ And Lot lifted up his eyes, and beheld all the plain of Jordan, that it was well watered every where, before the Lord destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, even as the garden of the Lord, like the land of Egypt, as thou comest unto Zoar.

A few reading the heading to this article will recall it is the title of a popular song sang by the late legendary “soul icon “ Wilson Pickett; in our time we had singers whose songs meant a lot their words were full of wisdom.

Wilson Pickett visited Ghana in the company of the Jackson Five ( Michael Jackson and his brothers), Staple Singers, and several other top-flight soul groups, If my memory serves me right I think Ike and Tina Turner were part to entertain Ghanaians at the Independence Square. It was a night to remember!

The program was arranged such that Wilson Pickett was to appear on stage exactly at midnight; which he did wearing a black slack with silver buttons that flashed dazzlingly. Guess what, he came on stage as the hour struck midnight with his evergreen song “ Midnight Hour!“

The crowd yelled and surged forward as he spoke the first words of the song “ Am gonna wait till the midnight hour”. And he did! It was a scene best seen/experienced rather than told/described. That was Ghana then!

Beloved, the mistakes many have made ( and are still making) in life can be attributed to the exercise of poor judgment. Like Lot, many have allowed the “ green grass “to fool them. As the scriptures said,
“And Lot lifted up his eyes, and beheld all the plain of Jordan, that it was well watered every where,”. Lot was undiscerning! He did what is described today as “ failure to read between the lines”.

Oh, how many an undiscerning youth have lifted their eyes and beheld all the fake, pretentious lives of glamour that celebrities portray on tv and other social media handles , and thought they are real. Only to be disappointed with the passage of time.

Yes, do not let the fake green grass fool you. In use in Ghana today is an imitated synthetic made “green grass” used mostly to decorate event grounds.

For a natural “green grass” to last long and not die/dry easily the soil must be well prepared, which activity takes time. It also requires regular maintenance . Beloved, for a success to last long, it would require a deliberate, conscious effort and preparation . One must be willing to invest, work hard and wait patiently.

There are many today who are in life’s scrap yard , gnashing their teeth because they were fooled by the “ green grass” !

Scripture is true, read a few ;
Proverbs 13
KJV
11+ Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathereth by labour shall increase.

Proverbs 20
KJV
21+ An inheritance may be gotten hastily at the beginning; but the end thereof shall not be blessed.

Proverbs 28
KJV
20+ A faithful man shall abound with blessings: but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.

Proverbs 28
KJV
22+ He that hasteth to be rich hath an evil eye, and considereth not that poverty shall come upon him.

The grass is not green everywhere, therefore be discerning ! Like , Lot don’t let the green grass fool you.

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: He Said It, And He Did It
data.text:
Luke 24
KJV
7+ Saying, The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.

Unlike political candidates who say many things but are unable to fulfil them, all that Jesus said about himself, and what He will do or be done to Him were all fulfilled. He was an amazing Man of His Words who must be taken seriously.

One such prediction is what you’ve read; that He will be betrayed, condemned and crucified and on the third day shall rise again.

When He first said these many were those who doubted Him, made mockery and ridiculed Him, but it came to pass.

In the early hours of the First Day of the week, the city of Jerusalem woke up to “ breaking news ! ”.

Three women on a fact-finding mission to the cemetery where He was buried met with an empty tomb. They hurried back to town to gossip their findings to a few. They gossiped because they were afraid.

But as is normal with gossip no sooner had they whispered this to a few than it became news that went viral.

Reporters and stringers from the Jerusalem Chronicle, Jerusalem FM John 3:16, Pilate FM, Matthew 27:24 and sister stations within and outside the city met with these women and interviewed them live on air.

They described vividly what they saw, the rolled stone, the empty tomb, and the man dressed in white who spoke to them.

They even repeated word for word what the white-clothed man said “Why seek ye the living among the dead? He has risen “

Yes, this is the Man Jesus. One newspaper headlined the morning’s publication with the words “ He said it, and He did It!” The curious nature of the headline made the paper sold fast that by noon it has sold over several thousands.

Yes without a doubt , that Jesus died , was buried and on the third day rose again from the dead is an undeniable historical fact

We worship a risen Saviour. Upon the first day of the week as we assemble to break bread and drink of the cup let our voices and hearts rejoice And may we do it from sincere , pure and honest hearts.

And., remember he who eat and drink in an unworthy manner, ( wicked , evil , unrepentant heart) eats and drinks damnation unto himself.

Maranatha

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: ”Low In The Grave He Lay: For So It Is Written”
data.text:
Psalms 16
KJV
10+ For thou wilt not leave my soul in hell; neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.

This was said many centuries before it found its fulfilment in Christ! Before then many have lived in anticipation of when this prophecy will come to pass.

Yes, “ thou will not leave my soul in Hell; neither wilt thou suffer Thine Holy One To see corruption “.
The final contest between the forces of Good and Evil, between Jesus and the Devil was that which began from His condemnation through his trial, the crucifixion on the Cross, his burial and finally ended with His resurrection!

Yes, by His resurrection He put to shame the nay-sayers, those who out of envy condemned and crucified Him thinking they had finished Him!

Yes, the same will be done to us who have pledged our loyalty to Him, our enemies, our doubters and naysayers shall humiliate and make a mockery of us!

Yes, beloved our enemies will bury us in disgrace, humiliation and dishonour! They will make our names a byword by soiling our image and reputation, but we shall rise to conquer in the end.

Just like how He rose from the dead even so shall we also rise from the depth of humiliation, disgrace and dishonor that our foes have buried us. We shall rise to fame and glory in the name of Jesus. Impossibilities shall become possible.

Yes, he who laughs last laughs best! It is the doings of the Lord, disgrace and dishonor can not keep us down; in the Name of Jesus we shall pull down the “ bars of shame “.

A hymn writer put it this way “Death can not keep its prey, he tore the bars away, up from the grave he arose with a mighty triumph over his foes, he arose a Victor from the dark domain and for forever with His saints to reign!

Yes, Low in the grave He lay Jesus, my Savior! Waiting the coming day Jesus my Lord!

Up from the grave He arose With a mighty triumph o'er His foes, He arose a Victor from the dark domain And He lives forever with His saints to reign

He arose! (He arose) He arose! (He arose) Hallelujah! Christ arose!

Vainly they watch His bed—
Jesus, my Savior!
Vainly they seal the dead—
Jesus my Lord!

Death cannot keep his prey—
Jesus, my Savior!
He tore the bars away—
Jesus my Lord!

Beloved, trust in the Risen Jesus in the face of challenges, He overcame and so will you. “Enemies are not God” is an inscription I saw written on a trotro bus. Only exercise patience! Jesus overcame, and you also will overcome!

Lessons I learnt from the death, burial and the resurrection of Jesus. These I share with you. He who laughs last laughs the best!

Have a blessed holiday

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: ”This Our Journey Of No Return”
data.text:
Ecclesiastes 3
KJV
22+ Wherefore I perceive that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion: for who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?

Ask again! “for who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?”

It is easy to forget that this journey that we’ve embarked on here on Earth is a one-way journey. We came with only a one-way return ticket. We can not return to our homes once we leave.

Our visas are one-way visas and are not renewable when they expire though under certain circumstances they can be extended but not renewed. Visa extension is discretionary and is subject to conditions set by the Issuer!

What is of great worry and concern to all travellers here is the undisclosed nature of the visas, especially their expiry date. No one knows when, where and how his visa will expire. How long we stay is undisclosed!

Though many have tried to inquire, investigate, speculate, propound theories etc; none has come out with any credible way of knowing when his/her visa will expire.

A hymn writer once said “Though men may search they can not find, for God alone does understand” Indeed the Issuer had stamped on the front page of our passport the following;

Deuteronomy 29:29
NIV
[29] The secret things belong to the Lord our God, but the things revealed belong to us and to our children forever, that we may follow all the words of this law.

This was intended to warn us to desist from undertaking such inquiries and investigations!

This being the case how should we then spend our days/year’s etc.?

For the answers, we are privileged to have the memoirs of one person who knew this “one-way ticket “ phenomenon and spent his stay in a certain way so we shall consult him to know how we ought to spend ours!

There is a warning however, it is not everything he said he did that is recommended so read with care, caution and discernment! Readers are warned!

Before his visa expired he gave a brief expose of how he saw his stay, a frustrating and disappointing picture. Read it;

Ecclesiastes 2:18-24
NIV
[18] I hated all the things I had toiled for under the sun because I must leave them to the one who comes after me.

[19] And who knows whether that person will be wise or foolish? Yet they will have control over all the fruit of my toil into which I have poured my effort and skill under the sun. This too is meaningless.

[20] So my heart began to despair over all my toilsome labor under the sun. [21] For a person may labor with wisdom, knowledge and skill, and then they must leave all they own to another who has not toiled for it. This too is meaningless and a great misfortune.

[22] What do people get for all the toil and anxious striving with which they labor under the sun? [23] All their days their work is grief and pain; even at night their minds do not rest. This too is meaningless.

Hope was not lost to him, read what he did and hence his advice;

[24] A person can do nothing better than to eat and drink and find satisfaction in their own toil. This too, I see, is from the hand of God

To conclude take note of the following; we came with a one-way return ticket. We shall not come back again. Our visas are non-renewable, even if extended they shall surely expire. As to when we are unaware. We wish we could know how many years remain on our visas!

Knowing this take his advice ;
Ecclesiastes 2:24
NIV
[24] A person can do nothing better than to eat and drink and find satisfaction in their own toil. This too, I see, is from the hand of God,

( Please do not “misread” or misinterpret the word “drink” to mean go and “ chill” you are a Ghanaian I know you 🤣)

But on a more serious note be guided by his final advice

Ecclesiastes 11
KJV
9+ Rejoice, O young man, in thy youth; and let thy heart cheer thee in the days of thy youth, and walk in the ways of thine heart, and in the sight of thine eyes: but know thou, that for all these things God will bring thee into judgment

Ecclesiastes 12
KJV
13 Let us hear the conclusion of the whole matter: Fear God, and keep his commandments: for this is the whole duty of man.

14+ For God shall bring every work into judgment, with every secret thing, whether it be good, or whether it be evil.

A holiday reading I share with you!

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: Long Forgotten
data.text:
Ecclesiastes 9
KJV
5+ For the living know that they shall die: but the dead know not any thing, neither have they any more a reward; for the memory of them is forgotten.

I have waited the whole day expecting to read from any tabloid what this day is noted for but to no avail.

Today 17th April 1967 was the day Lt. Gen. E.K. Kotoka died as a result of the abortive coup attempt by some junior officers of the military led by Lt. S. B. Arthur.

This took place some fifty -eight years ago! As the Bible says this event, its initiators and victims are all long forgotten!

Beloved, even so, shall we all be forgotten fifty-eight years from now. The majority living at that time will not remember us.

Life will go on as it is today with no one remembering who we were! People’s interest and attention would be as it is today on the economy, the fuel price, the exchange rate etc, and how to put food on the table.

So, enjoy and make yourself happy while you are alive today! I am going to get myself some light -soup to drink! For we brought nothing into the world and we shall certainly carry nothing away.

Nobody will remember us fifty years from now. Gen. Kotoka died on 17th April 1967 exactly 58 years today life goes on as it was before!

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: The Low Side Of Our Profession: An Observation
data.text:
Ephesians 4
KJV
25+ Wherefore putting away lying, speak every man truth with his neighbour: for we are members one of another.

Zechariah 8
KJV
16+ These are the things that ye shall do; Speak ye every man the truth to his neighbour; execute the judgment of truth and peace in your gates:

One negative practice that appears to be gaining ground among professing believers is the art of lying. Yes, you read it.
Like you, I’ve also asked were we born liars or we learnt them?

The ease at which lies are told with a straight face makes one wonder if lying is part of our nature. Some say it is part of our “fallen nature” which is true!

But, surely we were not born liars we learnt them, it is a habit we acquire through association. If you grew up in a lying environment the chances of you becoming one is very high! .

If you work or associate yourself with liars the chances of you becoming one is very high. It is also evidentially clear that certain professions thrive on lies to succeed so if you should work in such environments/professions the chances of you becoming a liar are high.

Please note, that I am not implying one is automatically a liar, but the chances of becoming one are high! A conscious deliberate self-restraint is what one needs to stay true to oneself in such environments /professions

It is therefore a “disease” that we contract through association, so let us therefore watch our associations and walk away from any that have the potential of influencing us to become liars

“Researchers” have found that Lie has sisters, these are “ sister rumour-monger”, “sister gossiper” “sister, hatred” and a younger “sister jealousy” Some have given their mother’s name as “Madam Envy”!

They described her as a ferocious woman who does not take kindly to truth, hard work and progress anywhere by anyone, she is feared worldwide. Read it;

Proverbs 27
KJV
4+ Wrath is cruel, and anger is outrageous; but who is able to stand before envy?

Who is able to stand before Mrs ( Mr) Envy?

Beloved, of great worry and concern, is how some have perfected this act of lying such that they are believed by even the wise! They know what to put together, how to present and say things, etc.

But why must someone lie? The reasons are many but the most important ones are, fear, insecurity, low self-esteem, inadequacy, and the craving for social acceptance and glorification (You can add yours)

Beloved, lies do not build, it rather destroy. It has been known to be the cause of breakdowns, and divisions among hitherto peaceful and loving relationships!

Dearly beloved if we can go by what the scriptures teach, we should not experience any such unpleasant situations; which is

Ephesians 4
KJV
25+ Wherefore putting away lying, speak every man truth with his neighbour: for we are members one of another.

To lie is to betray a trust, and trust is the foundation on which relationships are built once betrayed everything crumbles! Many a once-strong relationship has crumbled as a result Of this act.

To put back the pieces ( trust ) is a Herculean task even if done it never looks the same as the original. So let us be careful about things we say to and about one another.

May we heed Paul’s admonition
Colossians 4
KJV
6+ Let your speech be alway with grace, seasoned with salt, that ye may know how ye ought to answer every man.

May peace and truth be with and among us forever. Let us work towards achieving this! I desire to live in peace with you based on shared love and the truth we speak to each other.

My thoughts to share

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: How Will We Be Assessed?
data.text:
Matthew 5
KJV
20+ For I say unto you, That except your righteousness shall exceed the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees, ye shall in no case enter into the kingdom of heaven.

In a recent conversation with a friend, this issue of how are we going to be assessed came up! I tried to avoid, evade, and abort it but to no avail !! I kept saying “Can we change the topic, conversation etc but he kept asking! So we sat down to discuss it in an informal manner

My attempt to avoid it is simple I don’t know. Though I said this several times it was such that I had to yield. So what you are about to read are views we both expressed and shared.

We began by asking is it possible that there would be a pass mark. A range! A cut-off point, etc? We both concluded that yes it is likely. We based our conclusion on the above passage.

It is a comparative passage “Except your righteousness shall exceed the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees,” The word “ except “ is the operative word suggesting that there is a baseline which must be crossed.

The “righteousness “ of the Scribes and Pharisees was set as the baseline which must be crossed before one can “enter into the kingdom of heaven.”

Indeed the entire context in which this verse was placed indicates that the bar is higher for Christians.

I told some young men that the examination I wrote and passed to qualify me for a scholarship to study in the UK if it were today I’d have failed to qualify! Each generation or dispensation has its own threshold and standard of assessing who qualifies and who does not.

If this is so, then it follows that yes there is a criterion, a pass mark that one must attain to enter the Kingdom of Heaven.

So strive to attain this pass mark. The how is what follows in the second instalment.

What is important is to note that living recklessly, haphazardly, carelessly thinking o God is merciful, forgiving etc and will surely grant one a place regardless is to deceive oneself.

To excel in school we all know what it takes; ask to be told in case you don’t! Ask Azumah Nelson what it took him to become an undefeated champion

Even the great apostle Paul said this about himself and his quest to make the grade. Read it ;
1 Corinthians 9
KJV
27+ But I keep under my body, and bring it into subjection: lest that by any means, when I have preached to others, I myself should be a castaway.

My dear, there is a pass mark to be attained. Strive to make it. Before we parted company we both agreed on how difficult it would be. But we also agreed that God has given us a bonus mark; the righteousness of Christ! This has been credited to us. All that is left for us is to “top it up”.

God through Christ gave us 70% look for 30% to top up!

Matthew 5:20
NIV
[20] For I tell you that unless your righteousness qsurpasses that of the Pharisees and the teachers of the law, you will certainly not enter the kingdom of heaven.

Please this is not a doctrinal teaching or belief, it is a friendly hypothesis just to warn us of the need to be prepared! Surely we must cross a pass mark.
Philippians 2:12 NIV
[12] Therefore, my dear friends, as you have always obeyed---not only in my presence, but now much more in my absence---continue to work out your salvation with fear and trembling,

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: The Death, Burial and The Resurrection Of Jesus: Matters Arising
data.text:
Matthew 28
KJV
12 And when they were assembled with the elders and had taken counsel, they gave large money unto the soldiers,

13+ Saying, Say ye, His disciples came by night, and stole him away while we slept.

In a few days, the entire World will soon lay down its tools, industries will shut down, and in some places, massive processions through principal streets will take place with palm branches being carried, signifying the triumphant entry of this man into Jerusalem

Others will attempt to reenact an event that shocked the world -the death burial and resurrection of a young man who died thousands of years ago by carrying wooden crosses through the streets

This young man’s name is Jesus, and the event took place in a remote corner of the world, Jerusalem to be precise.

But why is this event regarded as significant? Why would the resurrection from the dead of this Man bring to a stop all activities of life? This is an incomprehensible global phenomenon!

Since the beginning of time no man’s death, not presidents, monarchs etc has ever been marked worldwide than this Man.

Why is this man’s death observed, it is because it was by this event that Humanity gained its freedom from Death. The resurrection of Jesus from the dead gave hope to a hitherto hopeless world that has until then been living in the fear of death.

Read how the Hebrew writer described man’s hopeless state before the resurrection;

Hebrews 2:14-15
NIV
[14] Since the children have flesh and blood, he too shared in their humanity so that by his death he might break the power of him who holds the power of death---that is, the devil---

[15] and free those who all their lives were held in slavery by their fear of death
.
By His resurrection, He *destroyed both the Power and Fear of Death! He brought to life immortality. A truth He stated while alive and confirmed by his coming out of the Grave. Read it;

John 11:25-26
NIV
[25] Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. The one who believes in me will live, even though they die; [26] and whoever lives by believing in me will never die. Do you believe this?”

Beloved, if there is no resurrection free from the dead then we’ve been deceived and doomed forever. Because it is the resurrection that gives us hope that there is life beyond the Grave.

It is the resurrection of Jesus that gave us hope that we shall be given an incorruptible body with which we shall live forever. As we can all attest to “ change and decay in all around we see”for we can not inherit the Kingdom of God while clothed in this corruptible body.

Read all that there is about this phenomenon;

1 Corinthians 15:42-44,50-55
NIV
[42] So will it be with the resurrection of the dead. The body that is sown is perishable, it is raised imperishable; [43] it is sown in dishonor, it is raised in glory; it is sown in weakness, it is raised in power;

[44] it is sown a natural body, it is raised a spiritual body. If there is a natural body, there is also a spiritual body.

[50] I declare to you, brothers and sisters, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God, nor does the perishable inherit the imperishable.

[51] Listen, I tell you a mystery: We will not all sleep, but we will all be changed--- [52] in a flash, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. For the trumpet will sound, the dead will be raised imperishable, and we will be changed.

[53] For the perishable must clothe itself with the imperishable, and the mortal with immortality.

[54] When the perishable has been clothed with the imperishable, and the mortal with immortality, then the saying that is written will come true: “Death has been swallowed up in victory.”

[55] “Where, O death, is your victory? Where, O death, is your sting?”
.
Yes, the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the Grave is a breakthrough for us who have placed our faith and hope in Him.
That we shall live forever is confirmed by this event that took place several centuries ago

Beloved, live your life in a manner as to benefit from this event at the end of your life's journey. Do not wait till it becomes late. Act now!

Maranatha!

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: Footsteps
data.text:
Psalms 17
KJV
5+ Hold up my goings in thy paths, that my footsteps slip not.

Anytime I read this verse it reminds me of mined fields that were found in Angola during their civil war where bombs and other bobby traps are hidden in the ground waiting for the innocent to step on them and be killed.

The effects of these traps were very harrowing and disturbing, they left people with amputated legs, deformed bodies etc. These are the “ fortunate “ ones for the majority of those who stepped on these bombs died.

After the war efforts were made to discover and demobilize these bombs. Another risky venture. Here is where the need to follow in the footsteps of others comes in.

Those undertaking the exercise carried with them probes, types of equipment that will buzz when they detect a mined field. After these have been removed others follow in their footsteps one foot at a time.

Beloved, this world is not a safe place it has been mined; the evil one through his agents has planted bombs in our paths to blow us off. Many are casualties because they did not follow in the steps of those who have gone before them.

We therefore need to follow in the footsteps of those who have gone ahead of us Those who have detected and demobilised these hidden bombs and traps of the evil one.

Read how some have described and recommended this practice to us ;

1 Corinthians 4
KJV
14 I write not these things to shame you, but as my beloved sons I warn you.

15+ For though ye have ten thousand instructers in Christ, yet have ye, not many fathers: for in Christ Jesus I have begotten you through the gospel.

16+ Wherefore I beseech you, be ye followers of me.

1 Corinthians 11
KJV
1+ Be ye followers of me, even as I also am of Christ.

Philippians 3
KJV
17+ Brethren, be followers together of me and mark them which walk so as ye have us for an ensample.

Philippians 4
KJV
9+ Those things, which ye have both learned, and received, and heard, and seen in me, do: and the God of peace shall be with you.

1 Peter 2
KJV
21+ For even hereunto were ye called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that ye should follow his steps:

Beloved, to avoid stepping on any satanic bomb or bobby-trap it is highly recommended that we follow in the footsteps of Christ, the apostles and any other person whose faith and example we greatly admire.

Like the psalmist may we pray as he did that the Lord holds and keeps our feet steady in his paths so our feet do not slip.

Psalms 17
KJV
5+ Hold up my goings in thy paths, that my footsteps slip not.

A word to the wise

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: Have You Ever Asked, Why?
data.text:
Matthew 9
KJV
30+ And their eyes were opened; and Jesus straitly charged them, saying, See that no man know it.

31 But they, when they were departed, spread abroad his fame in all that country.

I’ve come across a few things that Jesus said which I don’t get! One of which is what you’ve just read. You healed some people and placed a restraining order on them that they should not let anyone know! Aba!

Who lights a candle and places it under a table? For someone to put a lit candle under a table and not on top must have a serious reason or purpose! Why?

On another occasion ( the transfiguration on the mountain) he placed a limited embargo on the news going out public! Limited because He set a time frame. Read it

Matthew 17
KJV
9+ And as they came down from the mountain, Jesus charged them, saying, Tell the vision to no man, until the Son of man be risen again from the dead

Again to another;
Matthew 8
KJV
4+ And Jesus saith unto him, See thou tell no man; but go thy way, shew thyself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.

The incidents recorded above and His cautions beat the mind, the fact is the news of his healing would surely give speed to his message as many will take to him; which was the very reason why he came. And yet He forbade it.

Who would not like to advertise his success? Surely Jesus has reasons for stopping these recipients of His blessing. Though He did not state clearly the why, observing His actions does give us a clue.

The truth is the more his acts of mercy spread the more enemies he made for himself. Read this ;

Matthew 12:13,15
NIV
[13] Then he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” So he stretched it out and it was completely restored, just as sound as the other

[14] But the Pharisees went out and plotted how they might kill Jesus.

. [15] Aware of this, Jesus withdrew from that place.

Even alliances of people who once were enemies, who do not see eye to eye were formed to harm him; read it

Mark 3
KJV
6+ And the Pharisees went forth, and straightway took counsel with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.

In real life, this happens! People who disagree among themselves will unite to fight you because you are their common enemy. Hmm, life!

I’ve heard a few try to explain the reason for Jesus’ restraint; but “me too” having considered and thought through the events/incidents have come to agree with some who think otherwise.

These say “It is not everyone who should know or hear of your success”. Your failures they can be told! .

Others also say “do not show your wounds to everyone, not everybody has a plaster. Some will put in salt to increase your pain! “

Beloved on a personal note as I travel through life I’ve found these sayings or admonishments to be true. Perhaps you’ve experienced it yourself except that you did not take note nor care about it!

It was through experience that many understood why Jesus restrained these men not to tell everybody but was specific in one case regarding those they should tell! Read it ;

Matthew 8
KJV
4+ And Jesus saith unto him, See thou tell no man; but go thy way, shew thyself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.

His success story brought him enemies It got to a point that He could not walk in the open, the same has happened to some in real life; they kept themselves away from the company of others. Read it ;
John 7
KJV
1+ After these things Jesus walked in Galilee: for he would not walk in Jewry, because the Jews sought to kill him.

I’ve heard some give this same restraining order to some people they helped. They told them not to tell anyone. But good deeds can not be hidden they’ll come out just as those Jesus restrained did!!

Well, all said and done the advice is out there and it is a choice. Not everyone should hear of your success. Not everyone should see your wounds! Be wise! Not everyone who smiles with you loves you.

My thoughts after thinking through why Jesus restrained some from telling people of His deeds! These are my personal opinions!

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: A Worthy Advice To  Keep
data.text:
Proverbs 3
KJV
3+ Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:
4 So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.

The life that pleases both God and Man according to the proverbs writer rests on two pillars, mercy and truth. To show or have mercy and to speak the truth at all times.

Is it not true that people who show mercy and speak the truth are loved, admired and appreciated by the majority except a few?

To understand what mercy means in practical terms read these ;
Matthew 25
KJV
35+ For I was an hungred, and ye gave me meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me drink: I was a stranger, and ye took me in:
36+ Naked, and ye clothed me: I was sick, and ye visited me: I was in prison, and ye came unto me.

(also read the Parable of the Good Samaritan; that Of the Unjust Steward etc and many others )


What about Truth? We are to speak truth to all just as we are to show mercy to all. Here is where the difficulty lies. Whereas those who show mercy are loved those who speak truth are hated.

Is this not a contradiction? The very person you love because he showed you mercy, the same person you hated because he told you the truth.

But what is truth? (You remembered Pilate!)

Let’s begin with what truth is not, truth is not an allegation, it is not an assumption, I think, not perception, not a conjecture! Truth is a fact, even if it is hearsay you have investigated it and can confirm it with (empirical) evidence!

Read how the Apostle John defined truth regarding the humanity of Christ when it came under dispute by the Docetists. John’s writing (1john) was a response to the philosophy called “ Docetism” derived from the Greek word “ dokea “ which translates “ to seem, look like”.
( More about this another time)

John introduced his letter by stating who Jesus was,

1 John 1:1-4
NIV
[1] That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have looked at and our hands have touched---this we proclaim concerning the Word of life

. [2] The life appeared; we have seen it and testify to it, and we proclaim to you the eternal life, which was with the Father and has appeared to us.

[3] We proclaim to you what we have seen and heard, so that you also may have fellowship with us. And our fellowship is with the Father and with his Son, Jesus Christ. [4] We write this to make our joy complete.

So now you know what qualifies to be called truth. Facts. To speak truth is to say for sure and with certainty what one knows (substantiate with evidence when demanded or requested)

When Nathan confronted David concerning Bathsheba, he did not state a hearsay or an allegation but undeniable facts.

This is what the proverb writer is advising us to observe,
Proverbs 3:1-2
NIV
[1] My son, do not forget my teaching, but keep my commands in your heart, [2] for they will prolong your life many years and bring you peace and prosperity.

*Mercy and Truth” should not depart from you. Show mercy , yes but also be truthful!

These are hard, difficult and expensive but they are doable if one commits himself to doing them. There is always a price to pay for everything but the rewards surpass and are worth it.

A thought to share

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: When Words Mean Something
data.text:
John 1
KJV
14+ And the Word was made flesh, and dwelt among us, (and we beheld his glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father,) full of grace and truth.

In my earlier article, I made the case against inaction and the mere uttering of words! In this follow up l intend to demonstrate the example God showed us so we emulate Him.

Before Jesus came everything men knew about God was theoretical, hypothetical, etc. When they hear “ God is love “ it does not make sense it sounds ok in the ears but it can not and is not comprehended in real terms.

Everything taught to the Jews was theoretical; you’ll remember at the funeral of Lazarus Jesus engaged his sisters in a conversation.

Well let’s replay parts of that conversation to help you understand what I mean by before Jesus came everything about God was theoretical concepts

John 11:21-26
NIV
[21] “Lord,” Martha said to Jesus, “if you had been here, my brother would not have died. [22] But I know that even now God will give you whatever you ask.”

[23] Jesus said to her, “Your brother will rise again.” [24] Martha answered, “I know he will rise again in the resurrection at the last day.”

[25] Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. The one who believes in me will live, even though they die; [26] and whoever lives by believing in me will never die. Do you believe this?”

Here the subject matter was the “ resurrection “ and from what Martha said she has heard, and been taught all about this subject but she was made to understand that it was “ futuristic”.

No one can fault her she was right for that was what it was! Many things they were taught at their “rabbinical school” ( makaranta! Is the Muslim version) were theoretical

Now hear what Jesus said to her
John 11:25
NIV
[25] Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. The one who believes in me will live, even though they die;

Jesus said “My dear in times past the resurrection was a concept, but standing right before you is the real thing -I AM THE RESURRECTION” In other words “ the word ( theory, concept) has become real!

This is what John meant when he said
John 1:14
NIV
[14] The Word became flesh and made his dwelling among us. We have seen his glory, the glory of the one and only Son, who came from the Father, full of grace and truth.

God who in the past was a concept, imaginary thought etc took upon himself flesh so He can be seen and known, no more a theory. Fili fili!

This is what John said, they experienced Him, walked and ate with Him. He was real

1 John 1:1 NIV
[1] That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have looked at and our hands have touched---this we proclaim concerning the Word of life.

To John, their preaching was not theoretical but experiential. This truly is what effective, powerful preaching/teaching is about. Experiential not theoretical!

By the coming of Jesus, the Word became flesh. God who was hitherto mere words became a reality everything said and taught about Him was made manifest and demonstrated; made real.

In Christ, God backed His love for us in real terms! Beloved, God’s love for you is not a concept or theory ( mere words ) but real.

May we learn to practicalize our words through deeds so men will know what we mean when we say something! God showed us how to do it.

My thoughts to share

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: When Words Mean Nothing, But Sounds
data.text:
James 2
KJV
15+ If a brother or sister be naked, and destitute of daily food,

16+ And one of you say unto them, Depart in peace, be ye warmed and filled; notwithstanding ye give them not those things which are needful to the body; what doth it profit?

The greatest challenge we face as Believers is our inability to translate words into deeds. If you’ve lived as long as some have you’ll understand what this means.

James saw firsthand how members of the congregation he attended were responding to an appeal made on behalf of a destitute hence his inspired rhetorical question. He wrote from practical experience and observation.

In effect, he is saying words are meaningless if not backed by deeds. We see this daily in our fellowship where some stand in the midst of the assembly and pours out their needs! In our case, beloved what do we do? We are simply asked to stand and “ commit the sister/brother to the Lord’s care”.

A long twenty to thirty-minute prayer is said citing and quoting copious verses of scriptures to remind God (as if He has forgotten) that he must meet the needs of the one with the request.

We even issue as it were a “ veiled threat “ in our prayers by asking Him to act to avoid disgrace before unbelievers. Who will ask “Where is our God?”

After the prayer as usual we walk to the needy to shake his/her hands and console and comfort him/her with more words; not a hint or personal assurance of help from us.

This is what James was alluding to; read it
James 2:16
NIV
[16] If one of you says to them, “Go in peace; keep warm and well fed,”

Nyamè wô hô ôbè yè! Fama Nyame! Ôtsèsô Nyamè wô tsè à aboà entetià sô nyà bî ( forgive my poor twi!)

There have been instances where some have refused to tell their congregation the sufferings they are going through When asked why, they replied “ I know them they hear but do nothing! So I am better off not telling them”. O!

Yes, beloved this is what happens when words mean nothing but sounds to some, and because they would not want their ears to be disturbed they prefer not to open up!

There is a need for us individually and collectively to examine ourselves concerning these ! Words without acts mean nothing but mere sounds to a sufferer. This trend of behaviour is very high among us.

The Apostle John also saw what James experienced; read how he put it;

1 John 3:18
NIV
[18] Dear children, let us not love with words or speech but with actions and in truth.

I, John (the minister) have also seen and continue to experience this hence what you’ve just read. My testimony and experience are shared by many!

A word to the wise!

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: Concerning Registers: Which Is Which ?
data.text:
Revelation 20
KJV
15+ And whosoever was not found written in the book of life was cast into the lake of fire.

Local Church records on individuals are relevant for several reasons and purposes but it should be noted that these are limited to our stay here They’ll not be used in Heaven. Why?

Have you asked why? Well, the question is who will carry it there? If two people are the last to remain on earth then one dies and is buried by the other what happens when the last one dies?

Who will bury him, and assuming the church register was in his custody who carries it to Heaven?

I’ve said these to make the point that some think once they have their names on a church’s register that is.it; they pay no attention to anything not even their lifestyle and doings! Once they are regular at church so be it. They’ll be mentioned in Heaven!

You know this is not the case yet many by their actions believe it to be so.

As you’ve just read God or Heaven has its own register. From which qualified candidates shall be admitted. Names in this register are not categorized or placed under the congregation's names or where they are located

They are individual names with no country, tribe, etc listed against them. No bond or free, no poor or rich, no black or fair complexioned, no literate or illiterate, no fool or wise! No Laborer or CEO,

They are simply names of people who believed that Jesus Christ is the Son of God and by believing they gave themselves to be baptized and lived their lives in line with what pleases God.

Beloved this is all that there is to be admitted into Heaven. If you can do this you’ll be guaranteed a place! When Paul said to work out your salvation this is what he meant.

Philippians 2
KJV
12+ Wherefore, my beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.

Church register good as it is for local administration purposes, is no guarantee of admission to Heaven. Heaven has its own, make sure your name is in that one. How to do that is what you’ve just read.

Assure yourself that your name is there. I am sure you know this hymn; it is the way someone summed up what you’ve just read.


My faith has found a resting place,
Not in device nor creed;
I trust the Ever-living One,
His wounds for me shall plead.

I need no other argument,
I need no other plea;
It is enough that Jesus died,
And that He died for me.
2
Enough for me that Jesus saves,
This ends my fear and doubt;
A sinful soul I come to Him,
He’ll never cast me out.
3
My heart is leaning on the Word,
The written Word of God,
Salvation by my Savior’s name,
Salvation through His blood.
4
My great Physician heals the sick,
The lost He came to save;
For me His precious blood He shed,
For me His life He gave.

Thoughts to share. Salvation is a personal, not a corporate endeavour

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: Waiting List
data.text:
Matthew 25
KJV
41+ Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire, prepared for the devil and his angels:

Waiting lists of any type or kind can be very frustrating. It requires patience which on many occasions is difficult to practice.

Waiting list for interview. A waiting list for employment. A waiting list for admission into a college/university. Waiting list to board a flight. Waiting list at Telcos office just for SIM card etc.

In general, let us admit that “ waiting “ is a tough time, only a few can endure it.

In an article I posted recently I made mention of the fact that all who believe in Jesus are on a waiting list regarding their mansion above! Do you know that in like manner all unbelievers alive today are on the waiting list of the Devil?

Ever since he fell, he has also been busy building “cubicles” not mansions for his followers. It appears he has more on his waiting list and with limited space available to him the best he can afford is a cubicle.

If you want to know the size of a typical cubicle the devil is putting up for his followers, beloved ask an ex-prisoner or visit a prison to see for yourself.

You can apply to stay in one for a night for free l am sure the Warders will be glad to grant you the request. There you’ll get a foretaste of what it means to live in the heat.

With this in mind let us do whatever it takes to help those who are on his waiting list to remove their names and place them on that of Heaven

The majority of these don’t know the type of housing the devil is preparing for them. It is not a mansion but a cubicle. What we would call today an oven or furnace.

To those whose names are on Heaven’s waiting list please do your best every day to keep your name there! It is not automatic keep checking regularly by way of how you live!

My thoughts to share! Please help someone today!

John Franklin Tamakloe

Ask to be told, 
As a piece of advice Becomes handy 
When you are at the Crossroads ; 
Not knowing which way to turn

Ask to be told, 
And you’ll never;
Miss the way! 
Nor your blessings. 

Ask to be told 
Always remember 
It’s a four-word sentence 
Carry it with you every day.

John Franklin Tamakloe

data.title: My Gratitude To You!
data.text:
Hebrews 6
KJV
10+ For God is not unrighteous to forget your work and labour of love, which ye have shewed toward his name, in that ye have ministered to the saints, and do minister.

Mark 9
KJV
41+ For whosoever shall give you a cup of water to drink in my name, because ye belong to Christ, verily I say unto you, he shall not lose his reward.

The above is my prayer for you, that God would honour His Word and promise and bring it to pass in your life.

I received so much from you today ( Sunday ) and can not thank you individually but I’d like you to know that I appreciate everything you gave to me.

On behalf of my family, I say thank you. May the love that binds us together in Christ grow from strength to strength.

John Franklin Tamakloe
Minister ( retired)
